body_html:
hi, @andrewharp .

I am encountering the issue. Welcome any advice.

The results after adding LOG(INFO) << op_name; in KernelDefBuilder::KernelDefBuilder(const char* op_name) are as follows:
07-30 16:44:09.091 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.092 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.094 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.094 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.095 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.095 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.096 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.096 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.097 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.097 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.098 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.099 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.100 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSelect

But error occurs similar with @TianweiXing as follows:
07-30 16:44:16.619 3412-3412/? E/native: tensorflow_jni.cc:80 Invalid argument: No OpKernel was registered to support Op 'Switch' with these attrs [[Node: evaluation/while/Switch_7 = Switch[T=DT_STRING, _class=["loc:@evaluation/while/Merge_7"]](evaluation/while/Merge_7, evaluation/while/LoopCond)]]

PS: the code about control_flow_ops in python is "cf.cond(beam_gold_slot[0] >= 0, _ComputeCrossEntropy, _Pass)"

body:
hi, @andrewharp .

I am encountering the issue. Welcome any advice.

The results after adding  LOG(INFO) << op_name; in KernelDefBuilder::KernelDefBuilder(const char\* op_name) are as follows:
07-30 16:44:09.091 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.092 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.094 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.094 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.095 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.095 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.096 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.096 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.097 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.097 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.098 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 Switch
07-30 16:44:09.099 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSwitch
07-30 16:44:09.100 3412-3412/? I/native: kernel_def_builder.cc:24 RefSelect

But error occurs similar with @TianweiXing as follows:
07-30 16:44:16.619 3412-3412/? E/native: tensorflow_jni.cc:80 Invalid argument: No OpKernel was registered to support Op 'Switch' with these attrs [[Node: evaluation/while/Switch_7 = Switch[T=DT_STRING, _class=["loc:@evaluation/while/Merge_7"]](evaluation/while/Merge_7, evaluation/while/LoopCond)]]

PS: the code about control_flow_ops in python is "cf.cond(beam_gold_slot[0] >= 0, _ComputeCrossEntropy, _Pass)"
